definition: to go for a walk around/fig. to speak in a roundabout way
to wind/to coil (thread)/to rotate around/to spiral/to move around/to go round (an obstacle)/to by-pass/to make a detour/to confuse/to perplex
to bend/bent/a bend/a turn (in the road etc)/CL:道[dao4]
lit. to go on a long detour/fig. to speak vaguely around the topic without getting to the point/to beat about the bush
to go for a walk around/fig. to speak in a roundabout way

sentences.english: Let me be straight with u.
Even his rare mistakes can be made to be independent of any detours. Thus, on p.
sentences.chinese: 甚至他少有的錯誤也被認爲是獨立於任何繞彎的。

sentences.english: I deleted from the memory of the past need Raowan place.
sentences.chinese: 我從過去的記憶刪除了需要繞彎的地方。

sentences.english: He likes to come straight to the point without beating about the bush.
sentences.chinese: 他說話喜歡單刀直入，不繞彎子。
